title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.6.18 | 1-11-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञान तिमिरान धस्य ज्ञानान जनिशलाकया चक्षरुन मेलितम येना तस्महि श्री गुरवे नमहा
नमा ओम विश्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्री मते भक्ति वेदांत स्वामिन तिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शुन्यवादी पाश्चत्य देशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभूनित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधरा श्री वासादी गौरभक्त वृंदा
हरे कृष्णा हरे कृष्णा कृष्ण कृष्णा हरे हरे हरे रामा हरे रामा रामा रामा हरे हरे
ओम नमो भगवते वासु देवाया दारायनम नमस्कृत्य नरम चैवन अरोत्तमम देवीम सरस्वतीम व्यासम ततो जयमुदी रयेत
In this session we will be discussing from the 18th verse of the 6th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
रूपं भगवतो यत्तन मनकान्तं शुचापहं अपश्यन सहत सोतस्थे वैक्लव्या दुर्मना इवा
The meaning of this verse is
The transcendental form of the Lord, as it is, satisfies the mind's desire
and at once erases all mental incongruities
Upon losing that form
I suddenly got up, being perturbed, as is usual, when one loses that which is desirable
So, Srila Nargumuni is explaining his experience to Vyasa Deva
From his previous life, he began meditation
He had a glimpse of the Lord
And he became overjoyed with ecstasy
And he became overjoyed with ecstasy
And suddenly he lost that form
So then, after losing sight of that form
After getting a brief glimpse of darshan of that form
Of the Lord in the heart
Nargumuni is describing
What was the kind of...
Loss that he really felt
When he lost sight of the Lord
The transcendental form of the Lord, as it is, satisfies the mind's desire
The mind is the centre of all the senses
And the mind is driving the senses towards sense objects, looking for something
And the mind is driving the senses towards sense objects, looking for something
What is that sense?
What is that something that each one of us is looking for?
It is actually Krishna
Everyone is looking for Krishna
Having forgotten Him
And also desiring to get back that which we have lost
And also desiring to get back that which we have lost
The most desirable
The most beautiful
The most wonderful
The dear most
The dearest
We have lost that
So we are looking for that
So therefore
When we actually get darshan of the transcendental form of the Lord
Then immediately our mind's desire is completely satisfied
And also
all the mental incongruities are erased means in the mind we settle for something when we don't get what we are really looking for and we think maybe this can satisfy me

but then we find something else which may be relatively either better or more beautiful or more pleasing for the mind again it creates in the mind a kind of complex situation that maybe this is what I was looking for no no no this is not what I was looking for
so there are so many mental incongruities
essentially
established through contact with so many other forms other than the form of the Lord
so all these incongruities in the mind are completely erased when we actually get darshan of the form of the Lord
and that's what Narad Muni is describing here
so he says I lost that form which was completely satisfying to my mind
which erased the form of the Lord
which erased all my mental incongruities
that form I lost
and suddenly
on losing the form
all of a sudden I lost that form
then
I became very much
perturbed in my mind
and that is
to be expected because
when somebody loses something which is very very desirable
then how do they feel
that's how I felt
so Shrila Prabhupada makes a very important point in the purport here
that the Lord is not formless is experienced by Narad Muni
a widely prevalent understanding about God is that God is formless
Nirakar
Nirakar is one of the terms that is used to describe God
Nirakar is one of the terms that is used to describe God
it is one of the terms that is used to describe the Lord's features
but we should carefully understand what this Nirakar means
Nirakar means
the Lord does not have a material form
He doesn't have a form made of flesh and blood and skin and bones
No, He doesn't have such a form
He has a transcendental form
He has a completely spiritual form
He has a completely spiritual form
That form cannot be seen with these ordinary eyes
These eyes are suitable only for seeing some material forms
Even material forms which are very big we cannot see
Material forms which are too close to the eye we cannot see
We cannot see even our own eyelids
We can't see something very small
We can't see if there is no light
To see a particular object or a form
So, these eyes have got limitations
In any case, even if we overcome all kinds of limitations of this eye
By some mechanical means, material means
Still, spiritual form can never be seen
By any material adjustment even for these eyes
You cannot see spiritual form
With material vision
Even making adjustments
Not possible
So, here Srila Prabhupada is telling
Narada Muni's experience of seeing the form of the Lord
Is that Narada Muni is able to see the transcendental form of the Lord
By his spiritual endeavour
By his spiritual efforts
Not by any material efforts
No
But his form is completely different from all forms of our material experience
This is an important point
What Narada Muni saw
Was not just another experience
Of seeing a material form
It's not that
It is completely different
So, Srila Prabhupada explains
For the whole duration of our life
We go see different forms in the material world
But none of them is just apt to satisfy the mind
Nor can any one of them vanish all perturbance of the mind
Two things Prabhupada is mentioning
None of them can satisfy the mind
No material form can satisfy the mind
Completely
And
None of the material forms
Have got the
Power to
Erase all mental incongruities
That's not possible
So, therefore
What is mentioned by Narada Muni in this verse
Is very important to note
These are the special features
Of the transcendental form of the Lord
The transcendental form of the Lord
Is distinctly different from all material forms
And the special features are being mentioned specifically
By Narada Muni
That it completely satisfies the mind
Vision of the transcendental form of the Lord
Completely satisfies the mind
And it erases all mental incongruities
Further, Srila Prabhupada says
One who has once seen that form
Is not satisfied with anything else
This is a fact
Having seen
The transcendental form of the Lord even once
For a brief moment even
Then one can never be satisfied with any other form
The Lord is formless or impersonal means
That he has nothing like a material form
This is again being stressed
That Nirakar means
The Lord does not have a material form
Even descriptions of
Lord
Being impersonal
Means he doesn't have a material personality
Now, Srila Prabhupada is also explaining in the purport
As spiritual beings
Having eternal relations with that transcendental form of the Lord
We are life after life searching after that form of the Lord
And we are not satisfied
By any other form of material appeasement
See, this is a secret being revealed by Prabhupada
Based on Narad Muni's statement
That we are always looking
We are searching
But what are we searching?
We are searching for
The spiritual form of the Supreme Lord
Only that can satisfy our mind
Only that can give us the real
Joy
That we are looking for
Narad Muni got a glimpse of this
But having not seen it again
He became perturbed and stood up
All of a sudden to search it out
See, he got a glimpse
And he lost it
So he stood up all of a sudden
He was sitting and doing meditation
He stood up
And he began to search out
Where did I lose
How did I lose
Sight of that beautiful transcendental form of the Lord
What we desire life after life
See, it is not just this life
From the Bhagavad Gita we understand
We are spirit soul
For the soul
For the real you or real I
Or real person
There is no death
There is no birth
So our real nature is spiritual
But we keep changing bodies
As long as we don't realize our self
We don't realize the Supreme Lord Krishna
And our relationship with Him
As long as we don't realize these three things
We keep taking
Birth
Again and again
Simply
Quitting one body
Entering another body
What kind of body
Material body
So that is what is being described here
What we desire life after life
If we remain spiritually ignorant
If we are not fortunate enough
To come in touch with a pure devotee of Krishna
Then we remain in ignorance
We simply are engaged
In a hard struggle for existence
We keep searching
For that spiritual form
Transcendental form
Of the Supreme Lord
And none of the material forms
Are like that
Somebody may say
That the deity form in the temple
Is the transcendental form of the Lord
But then when we see the deity form
Without proper understanding
Without proper spiritual training
Then we see it as a material statue
We see it as a material statue
We see it as simply a statue
Made of metal or wood
Or clay or stone etc
We don't see it as a spiritual form
Though the deity is Krishna
The deity is completely spiritual
But unless our eyes are trained
Unless we have got spiritual training
Unless we have developed the spiritual vision
We cannot see the spiritual form
Of the deity
Through our ordinary vision
So I will stop here
Thank you very much
Hare Krishna
Thank you
